Topic.Title: Maybe I'm a cynic, but grocery move looks like more thrashing around...

Message.Msg: Obviously I'm tired when I say shipping cost decreasing. GROSS shipping cost as a % of net sales has been increasing... Net has been massaged through internal revenue transfers from Prime...

Topic.Title: Maybe I'm a cynic, but grocery move looks like more thrashing around...

Message.Msg: Once again, Amazon's moves do not address the fundamental economic issues/flaws with its physical goods business and current business model. But, it's good for another round of pump and dump. Take a close look at Amazon's net cash position changes by quarter over the past 3 years... Look at the increase in gift cards and days payable. Those two alone accounted for about $2.7B increase in cash since Q1 2012. The debt offering (net of buildings purchased) added another $1.5. And, yet, it still is trending southward...

Topic.Title: Maybe I'm a cynic, but grocery move looks like more thrashing around...

Message.Msg: Why not? In the end, it is still a profitable line of business. Surely you wouldn't blame businesses on "trying to find something profitable", would you?

Topic.Title: Maybe I'm a cynic, but grocery move looks like more thrashing around...

Message.Msg: sybs, it's not every stock that fundamentals don't matter in. In some they actually do matter and the stocks trade fairly much in accordance with the fundamentals. If you don't pay any attention to fundamentals you wouldn't know this. I will say in this over bloated market there is a #$%$ load of stocks where fundies seem to mean little. Usually the bigger and more well known they are, the more the ability for a disconnect to occur. It's obvious in looking at AMZN that this has been the case for years. However, you could also make a dopey case for going long on it trading at 2 times sales or some multiple of sales rather than looking at earnings because as we all know, earnings don't exist in this stock. Let's face it we are in a market where MOMOs have been in vogue. Not my speed except on the short or put side.

Topic.Title: Technicals-if 200 day MA is penetrated, looks like $220 will come fast

Message.Msg: Ex.goldbug: "if 200 day MA is penetrated, looks like $220 will come fast" You shouldn't gamble. If you think $220 will come quickly if the 200 DMA is violated, you should wait until that day comes. What you should ask yourself is, "What should I do if the 200 DMA doesn't get violated by [the date of your choice]?"

Topic.Title: Technicals-if 200 day MA is penetrated, looks like $220 will come fast

Message.Msg: 200 day moving average is only $10 below closing price. It also appears that the 50 day may break below the 200 day ("death cross"). Stock thrashes between $240 & $280 for a while longer (toppin/distribution) or it breaks down very soon. Breaking the 200 day will bring in cascade of automatic selling imho.
